intro: Aster trinervifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved aster, is a perennial herb native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Its leaves are narrow and often have three veins, giving it its scientific name. It produces small blue to purple flowers that bloom in the summer months.
